metadata.title: CVE-2019-14318 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Crypto++ 8.3.0 and earlier contains a timing side channel in ECDSAsignature generation. This allows a local or remote attacker, able tomeasure the duration of hundreds to thousands of signing operations, tocompute the private key used. The issue occurs because scalarmultiplication in ecp.cpp (prime field curves, small leakage) andalgebra.cpp (binary field curves, large leakage) is not constant time andleaks the bit length of the scalar among other information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcrypto++-utils - 5.6.4-9
libcrypto++6 - 5.6.4-9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcrypto++ package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.4-9').
